result.execSummary:
The defendant Diana M Maier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Supervised contact with daughter, must be supervised by a third party, or as deemed appropriate by Agent.
Parenting classes.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per months commencing 9/01/2017 or penalty of 4 days Huber for non-payment.
Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 53 days were granted.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 5/28/17 from defendant, re: sentence length/credit  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 5/30/17 - send form letter: "Judge Ramirez has received and reviewed your letter inquiring about trustee credit.  You must review jail credit issues with the jail staff to determine your eligibility for such credit.  The jail staff has the needed information and is aware when such credit can be granted."**
Letter from Atty Weathers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Diana M Maier in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendations. Atty. Weathers makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following: 

210 days Huber commencing FORTHWITH. Credit for 53 days. 

Costs: $243.00
 
DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/17. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 4 days in Huber.
Review hearing on May 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Letter dated 4/12/17 from defense counsel Weathers, requesting a Sentencing After Revocation hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 4/12/17 - yes. Set for SAR**
WCS report dated 2/6/17
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Diana M Maier in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  David John Behm and Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim was advised of today's hearing and did want to appear but has not. State requests an adjournment for victim to appear. Atty. Bucher objects. Court adjourns sentencing for victim to appear. Case recalled at 3:26 p.m. Same parties appear. Defendant pleads no contest to Count #1 of the Amended Information. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Bucher makes statements. Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
-Supervised contact with daughter, must be supervised by a third party, or as deemed appropriate by Agent.
	
-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

-Parenting classes

Condition Time: 20 days Jail-straight time. STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
